node.title: This week on "Sunday Morning" (March 6)
node.description: A look at the features for this week's broadcast of the #1 Sunday morning news program

node.title: NFL suspends its COVID-19 protocols, citing national decrease in case count
node.description: Players will no longer be required to adhere to rigorous testing or mask wearing.

node.title: January 6 committee issues subpoena to Kimberly Guilfoyle
node.description: Guilfoyle and her lawyers met with the committee over video conference last week, but abruptly ended the meeting.

node.title: U.S. to offer temporary legal status to Ukrainians, citing Russian attack
node.description: Temporary Protected Status, or TPS, will allow eligible Ukrainians already living in the U.S. to apply for deportation protections and work permits.

node.title: Iowa governor signs bill banning trans girls from female sports teams
node.description: The legislation goes into effect immediately.

node.title: Final shipment of crude oil on its way to NZ
node.description: The final shipment of crude oil is on its way to New Zealand - with the country's only refinery about to close. Audio

node.title: Critically endangered diving petrel population soars
node.description: The Department of Conservation says diving petrel are still under threat, despite an increase in breeding numbers Audio

node.title: Emergency doctor says staff shortages 'incredibly significant' amid spiralling outbreak
node.description: There are hundreds of frontline staff off across the city's hospitals, and emergency departments in Auckland have been swamped with cases on some days.

node.title: 'Very dangerous' situation: Severe weather continues to pummel NSW, Queensland
node.description: The NSW premier says "things will get worse before they get better" with up to 200mm of rain expected.

node.title: Son of January 6 defendant Guy Reffitt, testifies against his father
node.description: Jackson Reffitt was worried about what his father, a member of a far-right group, might do, after threatening that the goverment "is going to be destroyed in this fight."

node.title: U.S. halts deportations to Ukraine, Russia and 7 other European countries
node.description: The deportation pause comes as the Biden administration faces intensifying pressure to allow Ukranians living in the U.S. to apply for deportation protections and work permits.

node.title: Ukraine crises escalates across Russian space program
node.description: The director of the Russian space program severs commercial ties with the west; space station operations continue normally for now.

node.title: Hamilton City Council reduces services as Omicron bites
node.description: The Central Library will temporarily close from this Saturday due to staff shortages, while yesterday food scrap collections were also suspended.

node.title: Where are Russian oligarchs hiding their mega-yachts?
node.description: Some wealthy owners are "hightailing it on the high seas" as they scramble to move their yachts beyond sanctioned territory.

node.title: Man pleads guilty to LA break-in and murder of Jacqueline Avant
node.description: Aariel Maynor, 30, now faces over 170 years in prison.

node.title: Squash star Paul Coll caps off big week in style
node.description: New Zealand squash player Paul Coll has again showed his fighting qualities to clinch his first tournament victory as world No 1.

node.title: Meet the American teen tracking Russian oligarchs' jets
node.description: "It would be pretty cool to see one of their planes seized," said 19-year-old Jack Sweeney of his plane-tracking algorithm.

node.title: Jurors weigh fate of officer fired after Breonna Taylor raid
node.description: Brett Hankison has been charged with three counts of wanton endangerment, punishable by one to five years in prison.

node.title: One in 10 New Zealanders could be active Covid-19 cases - modelling
node.description: Active Covid-19 case numbers could be as high as half a million, or one in 10 New Zealanders, with many unreported positive results and others asymptomatic, according to modelling.

node.title: 'It's heartbreaking': Former Cantabrian helping Ukrainians flee Russia's onslaught
node.description: Distraught women and children face an uncertain future, often in freezing conditions in the likes of a town on the Romanian border, a World Vision worker says. Audio

node.title: In photos: Removing the debris of a protest that ended in chaos
node.description: A day after one of the most violent days in the country's history, tons of rubbish were being removed at the start of a costly restoration project.

node.title: Graham warns Russia will "wind up in the dark" over Ukraine invasion
node.description: Senator Lindsey Graham has been one of the most persistent and public critics of Russian President Vladimir Putin in Congress.

node.title: Russia's credit rating slashed to junk, same as Angola and Nicaragua
node.description: Downgrades by major agencies come amid worries that the Kremlin could default on billions in debt as sanctions hammer economy.

node.title: Asking price for typical U.S. home nears $400,000, a record high
node.description: First-time buyers face "challenging conditions" and affordability concerns, a real estate economist said.

node.title: Man sentenced to death for murder of Police Lt. Debra Clayton
node.description: Police used Lt. Clayton's handcuffs to arrest Markeith Loyd when he was captured after a 9-day manhunt.

node.title: NZ state-owned investors to sell Russian assets
node.description: New Zealand's state-owned investors are trying to sell some Russian assets.

node.title: Buyers snap up utes ahead of higher fees for polluting vehicles
node.description: New car registrations hit a record in February, as people flocked to buy utes before the new tax on polluting vehicles comes into effect.

node.title: West Coast DHB under fire from Reefton residents
node.description: Reefton residents voiced their dismay amidst shouts of "bulls**t" at a protest last night at the sudden closure of the town's hospital aged-care wing, after some residents suddenly moved out of the…

node.title: Hayden Paddon's WRC hopes boosted by Kiwi team
node.description: Hayden Paddon's ongoing hopes of a return to the World Rally Championship have received a boost in the form of a homegrown New Zealand team.

node.title: Navy recovers F-35 from bottom of South China Sea
node.description: The plane crashed in late January, and the Navy is investigating the cause of the crash, as well as the leak of a video of the plane.
